TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MsmqAuthenticationMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of authentication used for the binding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Values from this enumeration are used by the
<xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode%2A> property to indicate how a message must be authenticated by the MSMQ transport.
If security is turned off by setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode%2A> to None, then the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel%2A> property must also be set to <xref:System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel> for consistency.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.MsmqAuthenticationMode Certificate = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The client is authenticated using X.509 certificates. The client certificate must be present in the certificate store of the server.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.MsmqAuthenticationMode None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No security is used with this binding.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.MsmqAuthenticationMode WindowsDomain = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Kerberos is used for authentication. The client and server must be joined to a trusted domain.
